definition: to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
(coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons

sentences.english: Fascination and disgust clawed at one another in my confused mind.
sentences.chinese: 在我混亂的腦海中，驚奇和厭惡對彼此張牙舞爪。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a cat blocked entrance, rear its ugly plunged.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一隻貓堵住洞口，張牙舞爪撲來。

sentences.english: They ramped and raged like a pack of trapped beasts.
sentences.chinese: 他們像一羣被圍困的野獸，張牙舞爪，暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: An angry dog shows its teeth before it bites.
sentences.chinese: 一個發怒的狗先張牙舞爪，後咬人。

sentences.english: The ghost displayed his deadly fangs and claws trying to scare them.
sentences.chinese: 那個鬼在那邊就張牙舞爪地恐嚇他們。

sentences.english: Just stay too mask, in the dark claws.
sentences.chinese: 只留得面具，在暗處張牙舞爪。

sentences.english: It takes a microscope to make a handful of carrot seeds look like a swarm of bristling space invaders.
sentences.chinese: 顯微鏡下的蘿蔔籽們看上去像一羣張牙舞爪的侵略者。

definition: living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
bell made of copper or bronze
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
